poem:
The Observer's Dismay

Ink fades on foreign pages,
whispers of the world's pulse
caught in corporate webs.  
Voices that wander lands  
now tremble at silence,  
news halved by commerce.  
Yet truth seeks its bastion,  
a dove in stormy skies,  
while hearts heavy with witness  
watch, yearning to inscribe.
